title: I cannot afford all the books required for my UPSC preparation. What should I do? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: We’re living in the digital age, so, for most of the standard books, you can rely on the PDF versions that are available. Here is a list of sources you can use for curating books for UPSC preparation: NCERT official website and app: You do not need to buy NCERT books as they are readily available on the official app as well as the website. So, you can conveniently use it to read NCERTs.IGNOU materials: Similarly, there is an official IGNOU app that allows you to read the materials of all the courses on your mobile. It is called IGNOU e-content.Standard Books: Now, standard books such as Laxmikanth, GC Leong, etc can all be downloaded online. So, you can read the PDF versions of these books.India Year Book and Economic Survey: Both these documents can also be downloaded from the web. However, if you wish to prepare them, you can also join relevant micro-courses from test-prep institutes like Career Launcher or Vision, etc.I hope this helps. If you cannot find the required books, you can email me, I will help you with the required book!
